page.title: 12Family Life Dalgety Bay.
page.content: From a survey, we found that many families came from different parts of Scotland, England, Wales and America. This accounts for the many different accents in the town. The main reason for moving was that the husband had taken up new employment in the area. The majority of new jobs were in Edinburgh with a few with firms in the local industrial estates. Many families preferred to stay in Dalgety Bay as opposed to Edinburgh because it was more scenic; some families had their own yacht and wished to join the sailing club; house prices were marginally less than in Edinburgh ranging from 40,000 to 80,000 pounds and travelling time to Edinburgh by road is just 20 minutes.
